title: C Andrew Basham
text: Research Fellow in Medicine, Harvard Medical School

title: Projects
text: Descriptive and causal inference about post-critical illness survivor health, quality of life, and socioeconomic outcomes;

title: Projects
text: Descriptive and causal inference about post-critical illness survivor health, quality of life, and socioeconomic outcomes;

title: Projects
text:
Foundations for Pharmacoequity:
Data provenance, lineage, and epidemiological analysis methods for health equity, focusing on race and ethnicity data use in pharmacoepidemiology;

title: Projects
text:
Causing Careers:
epidemiological approaches to education and career planning, delivery, and evaluation.

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Education

PhD in Population and Public Health, University of British Columbia (09/2017–10/2021)
MSc in Community Health Sciences, University of Manitoba (09/2011–02/2016)
BA in Environmental/Urban Studies, University of Winnipeg (09/2004–05/2008)

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Postdoctoral Training

Research Fellow, Pharmacoepidemiology and Pharmacoeconomics, Harvard Medical School (03/2022–06/2024)

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Professional Appointments

Research Fellow, Division of Pharmacoepidemiology and Pharmacoeconomics, Brigham and Women’s Hospital (03/2022–06/2024)

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Professional Positions

Health Policy Analyst, Manitoba Keewatinowi Okimakanak (2008–2010)
Research Assistant, Department of Emergency Medicine, University of Manitoba (2012)
Statistical Analyst, First Nations Regional Longitudinal Health Survey, Assembly of Manitoba Chiefs (2012–2013)
Program Specialist, Aboriginal Health Programs, Winnipeg Regional Health Authority (2013)
Research Assistant, Centre for Aboriginal Health Research, University of Manitoba (2014–2015)
Data Analyst, Manitoba Centre for Health Policy, University of Manitoba (2015–2017)
Graduate Research Assistant, Tuberculosis Program, British Columbia Centre for Disease Control (2017–2021)
Teaching Assistant, School of Population and Public Health, University of British Columbia (2018)
Evidence Reviewer, McGill International TB Centre, McGill University (2021–2022)
Statistical Consultant, Faculty of Health Sciences, Simon Fraser University (2022–present)

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Selected Publications

Basham CA, Romanowski K, Johnston JC. “Life after tuberculosis: planning for health.” Lancet Respiratory Medicine, 2019.
Basham CA, Cook VJ, Johnston JC. “Towards a ‘fourth 90’: A population-based analysis of post-tuberculosis pulmonary function testing.” European Respiratory Journal, 2020.
Basham CA, Karim ME, Cook VJ, Patrick DM, Johnston JC. “Post–tuberculosis mortality risk among immigrants to British Columbia, Canada.” Canadian Journal of Public Health, 2021.
Basham CA, Karim ME, Cook VJ, Johnston JC. “Tuberculosis-associated depression risk: a cohort study.” Annals of Epidemiology, 2021.

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Committee Service

Local:

Lead, Pharmacoequity Research Team, Brigham and Women’s Hospital (2022–2024)
Learning Community Member, Health Equity Innovation Pilot Program (2023–2024)

National:

Judge, National Student Conference, Canadian Society for Epidemiology and Biostatistics (2015–2016)

International:

Chair, Global Indigenous Stop TB Initiative (2021–2023)
Member, Health Equity, Inclusion, and Diversity Special Interest Group, International Society of Pharmacoepidemiology (2023–present)

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Honors and Prizes

Research Staff Spotlight Award, Brigham Research Institute (2023)
Pillars of Excellence Award, Brigham and Women’s Hospital (2024)
Academic Excellence Initiative PhD Award, UBC President’s Office (2021)
Graduate Student Initiative Award, UBC Faculty of Medicine (2017–2018)

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Funded Projects

“Foundations for Pharmacoequity” (10/2023–ongoing): Brigham and Women’s Hospital Health Equity Innovation Pilot ($40,000)

Investigating missing race and ethnicity data in linked EHR and Medicaid/Medicare claims data.

“Multilevel Regression Analysis” (10/2023–ongoing): Developing a tutorial on drug utilization trend analysis and a workshop (unfunded).

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Teaching and Presentations (Last 3 Years)

Oral Presentation (07/2021): “Towards survivorship epidemiology,” Division of Pharmacoepidemiology, Brigham and Women’s Hospital
Oral Presentation (03/2023): “Diseases as drugs: a target trial emulation framework,” Division of Pharmacoepidemiology, Brigham and Women’s Hospital
Oral Presentation (10/2023): “Foundations for Pharmacoequity: Missing race and ethnicity data,” Brigham and Women’s Hospital
